bioghist.p: August Mencken (1889-1967) was an American civil engineer and author. He was the younger brother of Henry Louis Mencken, and the son of cigar magnate August Mencken, Sr. His works include First-class Passenger (1938), By the Neck; A Book of Hangings (1942), and The Fair Chanteuse, or, Science is Here to Stay (1958).

scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, clippings, and writings about or collected by August Mencken, Materials include: a copy of "A Model of the Confederate States Cruiser 'Alabama' Built by August Mencken, 1936"; clippings about the Alabama; correspondence related to Mencken's research on the Alabama; correspondence with the Naval Academy Museum about the disposition of his Alabama model; newspaper clippings and articles by and about H.L. Mencken; and reprints of articles on poetry and literature, many of which have authors' inscriptions to August Mencken. Several reprints are accompanied by correspondence to Mencken.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
